observation: I see a sign-up page for Deriv (a trading platform) asking me to select my residence/country. There's a dropdown menu that currently shows 'Select' as placeholder text, and I need to tap it to open the country selection. The page has large text and clear interface elements which is good for my elderly persona. I can also see some language selection overlays that seem to be open, which might be confusing.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select my country of residence to proceed with sign-up. The dropdown currently shows 'Select' which indicates I need to tap it first to see the available countries. I should focus on this main task and ignore the language overlays that seem to be open.
ux_issues: Multiple overlays (language selection) are open simultaneously which could be confusing for elderly users
The dropdown placeholder 'Select' could be more descriptive like 'Choose your country'

outcome.visual_observation: The Country/region dropdown expanded successfully, showing a search field and list of countries including Afghanistan, Aland Islands, Albania, Algeria, and Andorra with their respective country codes (AF, AX, AL, DZ, AD). The dropdown opened as expected when tapped.
